EE194/290C IC Design Project: 28nm SoC for IoT
Instructors: Dr. Osama Khan, Kris Pister
Units: 4
Meets: Tues/Thurs 4-5:30PM, 293 Cory
Pre-reqs: at least one of EE140, 142, 151;
In 15 weeks we will design a single-chip wireless sensor node "System on a Chip" with a
32 bit RISC-V processor and memory, 2.4 GHz radio transceiver, energy scavenging interface,
power management, on-board sensors, and sensor interfaces.  The (extremely challenging)
goal is to send the chip out for fabrication in 28 nm CMOS at the end of the semester.
One or more teams of students will divide the project into modules and work together
to design and integrate the modules into a single chip.  Topics include: Analog/RF mixed-signal
ASIC toolchain: layout, synthesis, extraction, verfication; design for test; matlab
system modeling; interface design; floorplanning; system simulation.
Overwork likely.  Not for the faint of heart.
Text: Brunvand, "Digital VLSI Chip Design with Cadence and Synopsis CAD Tools"
http://www.cs.utah.edu/~elb/cadbook
